easy.question: Which word is a verb?
easy.explanation: 'Run' is an action verb. The others are adjectives or nouns.

easy.question: Choose the correct form: 'She _____ to school every day.'
What tense is this? 'I ate pizza yesterday.'
Which is a linking verb?
easy.explanation: 'Is' connects the subject to a description (linking verb).

easy.question: What is the past tense of 'go'?
Choose the helping verb: 'I _____ finished my work.'
easy.explanation: 'Have' is a helping verb used in present perfect tense.

easy.question: What type of verb is 'taste' in 'The cake tastes good'?
easy.explanation: 'Taste' is a linking verb connecting 'cake' to 'good'.

easy.question: Complete with modal: 'You _____ study for the test.'
easy.explanation: 'Must' is a modal verb used to show obligation.

medium.question: What is wrong? 'She go to the park and plays soccer.'
medium.explanation: Mix of present 'go' and 'plays'. Should be consistent.

medium.question: Choose: 'If I _____ you were sick, I would have called.'
medium.explanation: Past perfect 'had known' for earlier past action.

medium.question: Which shows active voice?
options: The cake was eaten by him.
medium.explanation: Active voice: subject performs the action.

medium.question: Correct form: 'I _____ to that restaurant before.'
medium.explanation: Present perfect 'have been' for past experience.

medium.question: What tense is 'They will have finished by tomorrow'?
medium.explanation: 'Will have finished' is future perfect tense.

medium.question: Choose correct: 'The team _____ won the game.'
medium.explanation: In American English, 'team' (singular collective noun) uses 'has'.

medium.question: Which irregular verb is correct?
medium.explanation: 'Goes' is the correct present tense form for 'he'.

medium.question: Complete: 'I _____ finished if you help me.'
medium.explanation: Future perfect to show completion by a future time.

medium.question: What verb form follows 'can'?
medium.explanation: Modal verbs are followed by the base form.

hard.question: Choose correct: 'If I were you, I _____ the offer.'
Which shows subjunctive mood?
options: If I were rich, I would travel.

hard.question: Correct: 'By next year, I _____ here for five years.'
hard.explanation: Future perfect continuous (will have been working) works best, but future perfect is acceptable.

hard.question: Choose correct tense sequence: 'She said _____ to the store.'
hard.explanation: Reported speech requires shifting to past: said she went.

hard.question: What verb form is 'singing'?
hard.explanation: 'Singing' can be gerund or present participle depending on usage.

easy.question: I _____ to the gym every morning.
We _____ win the game.
easy.explanation: Modal 'can' for ability or 'will' for future.

medium.question: If she _____ earlier, she would catch the bus.
The book _____ by a famous author.

hard.question: Had I known, I _____ different choices.
hard.explanation: Mixed conditional: would have + past participle.

reading_comprehension.title: A Day in the Life
reading_comprehension.passage: Every morning, Tom wakes up at 6 AM. He goes to the gym and exercises for an hour. After that, he returns home and takes a shower. By 8 AM, he has breakfast and reads the news. He works from 9 AM to 5 PM at his office. In the evening, he usually cooks dinner or orders takeout. Before bed, he watches a movie or reads a book. Tom is happy with this routine.

questions.question: What does Tom do after waking up?
What tense is 'goes' in 'He goes to the gym'?

reading_comprehension.title: The Project
reading_comprehension.passage: Last month, Sarah started a new project. She has been working on it since then. By next week, she will have completed the first phase. Her team is very supportive and they have helped her whenever she needed assistance. The project could be finished by the end of the year if everything goes smoothly. Sarah is optimistic about the results.

questions.question: How long has Sarah been working?
What will happen by next week?
options: She will complete the first phase

writing_exercises.title: Write Your Daily Routine
writing_exercises.instruction: Write 5-7 sentences about your daily routine using different verb tenses.
writing_exercises.prompt: Describe what you do every day, what you did yesterday, and what you will do tomorrow.
writing_exercises.model_answer: I wake up at 7 AM every morning. I have breakfast and get ready for school/work. Yesterday, I went to school and studied hard. I will go to school tomorrow and have a test. I do my homework in the evening. I sleep at 10 PM. My routine is consistent and healthy.
criteria: Uses past simple for completed actions

writing_exercises.title: Correct Verb Errors
writing_exercises.instruction: Find and correct all verb errors in the passage.
writing_exercises.prompt: She go to the store yesterday and buys milk. She have finished her work last week. The team are won the game easily. By tomorrow, he will be completed the project. You should have told me before you leaves.
writing_exercises.model_answer: She went to the store yesterday and bought milk. She had finished her work last week (or: She has finished...). The team won the game easily (or: won the game). By tomorrow, he will have completed the project. You should have told me before you left.
